thread.title: Huge fire at historic Grade II listed church in Salford
thread.title_full: Huge fire at historic Grade II listed church in Salford | Granada - ITV News

author: itv.com
title: Huge fire at historic Grade II listed church in Salford
text:
Fire crews have been tackling a huge fire at a historic church in Salford.
Firefighters battled the blaze as it destroyed the roof of the Grade II listed Church of the Ascension, which was built in 1869.
Greater Manchester Fire and Rescue Service said six engines were sent to the scene in Ascension Road after being called shortly before 11.10pm on Sunday.
Play video Liam Cole, 17, rushed to the church after seeing flames from his nearby home.
He said: "Initially it wasn't that bad but all of a sudden it was engulfed in flames and the roof started falling through.
"There was a lot of ash and smoke from the roof going on the people standing very close."
Huge fire at the Grade II listed Church of the Ascension Credit: Craig Barclay Liam said he ushered away children and elderly people and checked they were not hurt using first aid knowledge learned at the City of Salford Squadron Air Cadets.
The fire brigade said no one was injured in the blaze, which was brought under control in the early hours.
Investigators are working to determine the cause of the fire.
Last updated Mon 13 Feb 2017 Salford
